repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript belonged to Édouard-Simon Ariel (1818-1854). It contains a total of 564 verb roots that are subdivided into seven different booklets according to their initial letter. Letters run from ந to வ.
Description based on the digitized version.

filiation.p: Indien 160 is the preceding volume where Tamil roots start from the letter a.

p.p: As it occurs in manuscript Indien 194 from the same author, different kinds of paper can be found: a) brownish and thick paper; b) a light yellowish colour; or c) a darker yellowish colour paper.

Even the size of the paper may differ. Hence, one finds not only pages which are smaller, but also different sized paper resembling notes, sometimes written in the light blue colour paper and pasted on the main page as if they were an errata corrige. Examples can be see at ff. 58r, 294r, 336r, 123r, 365r.

extent.measure: 2 front guard leaves + 456 + 4 back guard leaves (u1 + U1 + u2)

foliation.p: Foliation starts with the number one and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto of each folio. This occurs up to f. 306r until when each page contains one single verb root. Then, from f. 306r onwards, it may occur that the page is constituted by more than one piece of folio, each one with a different verb root. They appear to be pasted together as forming one single folio. For this reason our foliation is based on one single folio rather than on two or three. Examples of these occurrences are found at ff. 307r which includes verb root n. 308 and 309; f. 308r (verb root 310, 311); f. 310r (verb root 313, 314) f. 312r (verb root 316-318); f. 313r (verb root 319, 320); f. 314r (verb root 321,322); f. 315r includes verb root (323, 324); f. 317r (verb root 316, 327); f. 320r (verb root 330, 331); f. 321r (verb root 332); f. 325r (verb root 336, 337); f. 327r (verb root 339-341); f. 328r (verb root 342, 343); f. 329r (verb root 344-346); f. 331r (verb root 349-350); f. 333r (verb root 352, 353); f. 337r (verb root 357, 358); f. 347r (verb root 369-371); f. 348r (verb root 372, 373); f. 350r (verb root 375, 376); f. 351r (verb root 377, 378); f. 354r (verb root 381-383); f. 355r (verb root 384-386); f. 359r (verb root 390, 391); f. 361r (verb root 393, 394); f. 362r (verb root 395, 396); f. 363 (verb root 397, 398); f. 367r (verb root 402-404); etc.

There are only few occurrences in which there is another erased number next to the one representing the main foliation. Example can be seen at ff. 80r (there is also number 347), 345r (there is also number 366).

However, foliation is always written on the upper right side of the recto of each folio or piece of folio, while the verso are left blank unless: 1. it is an already used paper and what was written earlier is deleted; 2. there is the need for more space for the description of the Tamil verb root on the recto as it may be seen in the following examples: ff. 3, 10, 15, 18, 23, 52, 55, 63, 65, 66, 69, 106, 124, 144, 153, 158, 160, 177, 184, 185, 188, 191, 224, 231, 233, 234, 237, 238, 239, 245, 258, 259, 267, 276, 300, ,309, 311, 319, 320, 321, 330, 334, 335, 336, 338, 339, 340, 344, 356, 357, 364, 366, 373, 389, 403, 404, 415, 419, 421, 422, 423, 427, 430, 432, 434, 436, 451, 456.

additions.desc:
There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the writing Bibliothèque Impérial MSS. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing Don n°. Example of this combination can be found at: ff. 137r, 226r, 346r, 392v, 396r, 453r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61).
In some other cases only the first stamp is found like in ff. 224v, 344v, 398r, 453r.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside. Collection of loose folios, sometimes of different size and colours, collected togheter.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manusript by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his permanence in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnof (1801-1852) in Paris (see James 2000: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque National with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
